if someone is reinstated, they are officially given back their job after it was taken away
to make something such as a law, system, or rule exist again
California reinstated the death penalty in 1977.
to put someone back into a job or position of authority from which they had previously been removed
His claim of unfair dismissal was upheld and he was later reinstated.
She was cleared by the investigation and immediately reinstated as Finance Director.
to put back into a document, agreement etc something that had previously been taken out
We agreed to reinstate this clause in the contract.
to bring back into effect an insurance POLICY that has not been in effect for some time, for example because the regular payments for it have not been made
